question: 徳川
sourceMnemonic: This is one of those words that makes more sense when you look at the reading. The "Virtue River" isn't some virtuous river, it's in fact the <vocabulary>Tokugawa</vocabulary> family name, also known as the <vocabulary>Tokugawa Shogun</vocabulary>. They ran Japan for a while, you know?
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings are <ja>徳</ja> and the vocab <ja>川</ja> put together into one word. Once you can read this, you'll know the meaning too, so focus on the reading for this one.
